byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney and Ian Lovett reported from San Bernardino, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Reporting was contributed by Rebecca Fairley Raney and Jennifer Medina from San Bernardino; Julie Turkewitz from Anaheim; Marc Santora, Benjamin Mueller, Ashley Southall, Jack Begg, Susan C. Beachy, Erik Eckholm and Timothy Williams from New York; Michael S. Schmidt and Kitty Bennett from Washington; and Jack Healy from Denver.
byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, IAN LOVETT and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Gunmen open fire in social services center in San Bernardino, Calif, killing at least 14 people and wounding at least 17 before leading law enforcement on manhunt that paralyzes much of city; hunt culminates in confrontation that leaves two suspects dead, and third person who may have been involved in custody; authorities are trying to determine motive for shooting.
lead_paragraph: The suspects, Syed Farook and Tashfeen Malik, were killed after a shooting at a social services center. Family members said the two were married.

headline.main: San Bernardino Shooting Kills at Least 14; Two Suspects Are Dead
headline.print_headline: Shooting Rampage Sows Terror in California

snippet: The suspects, Syed Farook and Tashfeen Malik, were killed after a shooting at a social services center. Family members said the two were married.
